questions.question: What is the concept of jivanmukti?
questions.answer: Liberation while living

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a liberated being?
questions.answer: Attachment to worldly possessions

questions.question: What is the term for effortless action in a liberated state?
questions.answer: Sahaja

questions.question: How does a jivanmukta balance spiritual practice with worldly responsibilities?
choices: Through the practice of karma yoga
questions.answer: Through the practice of karma yoga

questions.question: What is the primary focus of self-inquiry in this context?
questions.answer: Questioning the nature of the 'I'

questions.question: What is witness consciousness?
choices: Observing one's thoughts and experiences without identification
questions.answer: Observing one's thoughts and experiences without identification

questions.question: According to the module, what is the nature of the perceived world in the philosophy of living enlightenment?
choices: A kind of dream or projection
questions.answer: A kind of dream or projection

questions.question: What is vairagya?
choices: Dispassion or detachment from worldly objects
questions.answer: Dispassion or detachment from worldly objects

questions.question: What is the difference between jivanmukti and videhamukti?
choices: Jivanmukti is liberation while living, videhamukti is liberation after death
Videhamukti is liberation while living, jivanmukti is liberation after death
Jivanmukti is for laypeople, videhamukti is for monks
questions.answer: Jivanmukti is liberation while living, videhamukti is liberation after death

questions.question: How does a liberated being view praise and censure?
choices: They seek praise and avoid censure
They are affected equally by both
They are not affected by either
questions.answer: They are not affected by either

questions.question: What is viveka?
choices: Discrimination between the real and unreal
questions.answer: Discrimination between the real and unreal

questions.question: How does a jivanmukta view the self in relation to others?
choices: As the same self in all beings
questions.answer: As the same self in all beings

questions.question: What is the attitude of a liberated being towards their actions?
choices: They have a strong sense of doership
They feel guilty about their actions
They have no sense of doership or enjoyment
They only perform actions for personal gain
questions.answer: They have no sense of doership or enjoyment

questions.question: According to the module, how can routine tasks be transformed?
choices: By transforming them into spiritual practice through mindfulness
By doing them as quickly as possible
questions.answer: By transforming them into spiritual practice through mindfulness

questions.question: What is the recommended approach to fulfilling worldly duties according to the concept of jivanmukti?
choices: Performing duties with excellence but without identification
questions.answer: Performing duties with excellence but without identification

questions.question: What is mumuksutva?
questions.answer: Intense desire for liberation

questions.question: How does a liberated being perceive the universe according to Yoga Vasishta?
choices: As a punishment for past actions
questions.answer: As a play of consciousness

questions.question: What is the significance of the story of King Janaka in relation to enlightenment?
choices: It shows that enlightenment takes many lifetimes
It demonstrates that rulers cannot attain enlightenment
It illustrates that enlightenment can be instantaneous
It proves that enlightenment requires renunciation of worldly life
questions.answer: It illustrates that enlightenment can be instantaneous

questions.question: According to the module, what is the relationship between liberation and time?
choices: Liberation always occurs in the future
Liberation is a gradual process over time
Liberation is not bound by time and is always in the present
Liberation only occurs at the time of death
questions.answer: Liberation is not bound by time and is always in the present

questions.question: How does the concept of jivanmukti challenge conventional notions of spiritual practice?
choices: It suggests that spiritual practice is unnecessary
It emphasizes the importance of asceticism
It proposes that liberation is possible while engaged in worldly life
It states that liberation is only for a select few
questions.answer: It proposes that liberation is possible while engaged in worldly life

questions.question: What is the attitude of a liberated being towards pleasure and pain?
choices: They seek pleasure and avoid pain
They are indifferent to both pleasure and pain
questions.answer: They are indifferent to both pleasure and pain

questions.question: How does the concept of karma yoga relate to living enlightenment?
choices: It encourages accumulation of good karma
It teaches detachment from the fruits of action
It promotes inaction to avoid creating karma
It focuses on balancing past karma
questions.answer: It teaches detachment from the fruits of action

questions.question: What is the primary obstacle to realization according to the teachings on jivanmukti?
questions.answer: Ignorance of one's true nature

questions.question: How does a liberated being relate to their thoughts and emotions?
choices: By suppressing all thoughts and emotions
By indulging in every thought and emotion
By analyzing the source of each thought
questions.answer: By observing them without identification

questions.question: What is the significance of self-inquiry in the path to liberation?
choices: It leads to better memory of past lives
It directly challenges the notion of a separate self
questions.answer: It directly challenges the notion of a separate self

questions.question: According to the teachings, what is the nature of true freedom?
choices: The ability to do whatever one wants
Liberation from the illusion of separateness
questions.answer: Liberation from the illusion of separateness

questions.question: How does the concept of jivanmukti view the relationship between the individual and the world?
choices: As an illusion to be transcended
As interconnected aspects of the same reality
questions.answer: As interconnected aspects of the same reality

questions.question: What is the role of compassion in the state of living enlightenment?
choices: It arises spontaneously without personal motive
It is irrelevant to the state of enlightenment
It is directed only towards other spiritual seekers
questions.answer: It arises spontaneously without personal motive

questions.question: How does a liberated being view their own body according to these teachings?
choices: As an illusion to be ignored
As a vehicle for experience, without identification
As a hindrance to spiritual progress
questions.answer: As a vehicle for experience, without identification

questions.question: What is the significance of the present moment in the context of living enlightenment?
choices: It is less important than planning for the future
It is the only reality in which liberation can be realized
It should be ignored in favor of spiritual goals
It is a distraction from true spiritual practice
questions.answer: It is the only reality in which liberation can be realized
